metadata.title: CVE-2020-27824 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in OpenJPEGâ€™s encoder in theopj_dwt_calc_explicit_stepsizes() function. This flaw allows an attackerwho can supply crafted input to decomposition levels to cause a bufferoverflow. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27824` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libopenjp2-7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp2-tools - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp3d-tools - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjp3d7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-dec-server - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-server - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip-viewer - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
libopenjpip7 - 2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1
No subscription required

ghostscript - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
ghostscript-x - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
libgs9 - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
libgs9-common - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjpeg2 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.3.0-2+deb10u2build0.18.04.1').
insighttoolkit4 package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
blender package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
texmaker package in esm-apps/bionic is affected and may need fixing.
ghostscript package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.14').
